item.title: Management simulation game MANIFESTO announced for PC
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Definitely not about the video games industry.

Publisher No More Robots and developer Breakpoint Games have announced MANIFESTO, a management simulation game about “burnout, layoffs, and making shitloads of money.” It will launch for PC via Steam in 2026. A demo is available now.

Here is an overview of the game, via No More Robots:

About

MANIFESTO is a new management sim about burnout, layoffs, and making shitloads of money.

You’ve climbed the ranks, left countless competitors in your wake, and proven you have what it takes to survive in this cut-throat business. With this latest venture, you’ll have to put any human feelings you’ve ever experienced aside, and attempt to satisfy shareholders who can never truly be satisfied.

Key Features

  • Make extremely ethical decisions to keep the sales flowing.
  • Hire employees, then burn them out for profit.
  • Reach entirely unrealistic sale targets in a small amount of time.
  • Unlock power-ups and stack effects to juice those numbers.
  • Expand and level up your company, but try not to crumble under the pressure.

Is This Some Kind of Commentary on the Current State of the Video Game Industry?

Oh god no, we wouldn’t dream of it. There’s zero chance we would use the medium of video games to comment on the fact that one-third of developers were laid off in the last two years. Or that CEOs and upper management take huge bonuses, while employees take all the brunt of their crappy choices. MANIFESTO is just a video game, stop reading into things that aren’t there, okay?

Watch the announcement trailer below.

item.title: Co-op tactics roguelite game Shadowstone announced for PC
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Due out in Early Access in 2026.

Publisher Dreamhaven and Sunderfolk developer Secret Door have announced Shadowstone, a turn-based cooperative tactics roguelite game for up to four players. It will launch in Early Access for PC via Steam and Epic Games Store in 2026 for $14.99.

“Shadowstone is a natural next step for our team after Sunderfolk,” said Secret Door studio head Chris Sigaty in a press release. “Inspired by some of our favorite roguelikes, the world and characters of the Sunderlands are back, but in a more dangerous, more challenging, and even more engaging strategic experience.”

Dreamhaven CE and co-founder Mike Morhaime added, “The team at Secret Door continues to innovate with games that bring people together in positive ways. Shadowstone reflects that commitment by expanding the beloved Sunderfolk universe, and in a way that allows players to group up or take on this challenging adventure solo.”

  • ❮
  • ❯

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

Shadowstone is a one-to-four-player tactics game where players must master strategic positioning and powerful hero synergies to survive against the unrelenting horrors of the Sunderlands.

Key Features

  • Master Tactical Gameplay – Deliberate positioning and manipulation of elements in each encounter is core to the turn-based tactical gameplay of Shadowstone. Survival hinges on utilizing your hero’s unique skills such as using the Witch’s ability to duplicate healing and exploding mushrooms or the Berserker’s charge to displace enemies into dangerous lava.
  • Endless Combinations – Each attempt to escape the shadowstone infested ruins presents a new nightmare with an endless array of randomized rooms and monsters. Players must adapt their strategy every run, relying on a constantly evolving pool of skill cards, versatile equipment, and adaptive powerups.
  • Powerful Hero Synergies – Build overpowered synergies by upgrading and selecting complementary spells across your heroes. Execute complex multi-hero ability combinations to devastate enemy monsters, even when playing solo.
  • Up to Four-Player Cooperative Play – Take command of multiple heroes solo, or band together with up to four players in online multiplayer. Mastering the strengths and weaknesses of different party compositions with highly cooperative strategy is essential to survive against the horrors shrouded in shadowstone power.

Early Access

We’re building Shadowstone alongside our players. Join our Discord to stay in the loop on development and sign up for a chance to jump into our next playtest.

item.title: Sunderfolk version 2.0 update launches March 10
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox Series

Adds Vanguard hero, two new mission sets, and more.

Publisher Dreamhaven and developer Secret Door have announced the version 2.0 update for fantasy couch cooperative tactical adventure game Sunderfolk, which will add new content including the tank-style Vanguard hero and two new sets of missions. It will launch on March 10.

Here is an overview of the update, via Dreamhaven:

  • Mouse and Keyboard Controls – Sunderfolk‘s version 2.0 update overhauls the game’s user interface on PC to support mouse and keyboard controls for solo play and online multiplayer while maintaining phone controller support for couch cooperative play.
  • PC Online Multiplayer – PC players can team up with their friends through online player-hosted sessions. Each player must have their own copy of Sunderfolk.
  • The Vanguard Hero – Vanguard expands Sunderfolk‘s roster of playable heroes to seven and adds a small but mighty brawler for adventurers who prefer playing both offensively and defensively. The Vanguard’s burning spirit makes them fit for the heart of battle, where they unleash devastating blows while serving as a shield for their allies.
  • More Missions – Through Sunderfolk‘s One Shot Mode, players can tackle the “Sacred Sand” and “Arena Rumble” sets of missions that connect as a continuous experience. “Sacred Sand” includes four missions in which players must help the Sacred Bug reclaim her lost home from a powerful enemy. “Arena Rumble” is a three-mission tournament where players battle for glory in the Ogre Arena.

Sunderfolk is available now for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch, and PC via Steam, and will launch via Epic Games Store alongside the update on March 10.
